title: Optimize ainit slash command to use shell script instead of per-file LLM tool calls
description: The /ainit slash command currently instructs Claude to read and write template files one by one (~20 tool calls, each a full LLM round-trip), making initialization very slow. Refactor to embed a shell script that performs all file copies in a single bash execution, reducing tool calls from ~20 to 2-3.
acceptance_criteria: ainit binary installs an ainit-setup.sh script to ~/.claude/ainit-templates/
The shell script handles all file copying, directory creation, backlog.json initialization, and CLAUDE.md appending
The /ainit slash command is simplified to: run the script, then confirm results
Project initialization completes in 2-3 LLM tool calls instead of ~20
All existing functionality is preserved (agent files, backlog.mjs, workflow.md, backlog-protocol.md, CLAUDE.md update)
make build and make test pass
